relevant_findings.neurological_examination: Initially alert with an otherwise normal neurological examination. Developed left hemiparesis and further twitching of the left upper extremity.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient's neurological condition rapidly deteriorated from normal examination to becoming unrousable and developing left hemiparesis.

relevant_findings.clotting_tests: Initial PT greater than 160 seconds and aPTT greater than 200 seconds, later improved to PT of 32 seconds and aPTT of 42.9 seconds post-transfusion.
relevant_findings.hematoma: Acute hemorrhage in the right frontal lobe with edema.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Postoperative clotting results showed minimal improvement despite treatment.

relevant_findings.neurodevelopment: Child is well with no neurological deficit and attaining developmental milestones.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Significant improvement noted; child recovered well post-surgery.
